page.title: 16LILLESHALL OLD HALL
page.content: Lilleshall Old Hall once belonging to the Leveson Gower family (the 1st. Duke of Sutherland) is now an old peoples' home belonging to 'Old Ben' an organisation set up to look after retired employees of the newspaper industry who can no longer support themselves. Until 1983 part of the building was leased to Shropshire County Council to house part of Lilleshall Primary School. In 1983 a new school building was provided elsewhere and the building has now become part of the old peoples' home. In the grounds of The Old Hall is a large pond stocked privately by local fisherman for sport - mainly trout fishing.
